Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Hyperthermic Intraperitoneal Chemotherapy in Advanced Ovarian Cancer

Participants.evidence: 184 patients with stage III or IV ovarian cancer and residual tumor size less than 1 cm

Intervention.evidence: randomised (1:1) to receive HIPEC (41.5 °C, 75 mg/m² of cisplatin, 90 minutes) or standard care

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the clinical benefit of hyperthermic intraperitoneal chemotherapy (HIPEC) following primary or interval cytoreductive surgery in women with stage III or IV ovarian cancer.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was progression-free survival, measured from randomisation to disease progression or death.

Blinding.evidence: participants were blinded to group allocation

Result_Outcome.evidence: HIPEC improved progression-free survival (HR, 0.60; 95% CI, 0.37-0.99; P = .04) and overall survival (HR, 0.53; 95% CI, 0.29-0.96; P = .04)

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were more frequent in the HIPEC group, with increased prothrombin time and acute kidney injury being notable.
